p: The vast majority of countries found themselves in the third group. After a short period in which they tried to stop the virus through their “first lines of defense”, they all had to move to a back-up plan. This involved them closing the borders, schools and banning public gatherings. They were then quarantined for several weeks to prevent the contagion and significantly reduce the daily number of new cases of coronavirus infection. During the quarantine period, exit strategies were being considered on how to co-exist with the virus until effective drugs or vaccines could be made.
